snippet: With only days left on the legislative calendar, state lawmakers and Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo are ensconced in negotiations over a new medical marijuana program.
abstract: New York State lawmakers and Gov Andrew M Cuomo, with only days left on legislative calendar, are deep in negotiations over new medical marijuana program; critical difference between bill favored by legislative leaders, known as the Compassionate Care Act, and Cuomo's vision on issue is whether drug could be smoked, which Cuomo opposes.
lead_paragraph: With only days left on the legislative calendar, state lawmakers and Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo are ensconced in negotiations over a new medical marijuana program.

headline.main: Talks on Medical Marijuana Bill as Time Starts to Run Out in Albany
headline.print_headline: Talks on Marijuana Bill as Time Runs Out
